title: HTML Basics: Your First Step into Web Development

content.text: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It's the standard language used to create web pages. Think of HTML as the skeleton of a web page. Just like your body has a structure that gives it shape, HTML gives structure to web content. It uses 'tags' to tell the web browser how to display text, images, and links. Every web page you see is built using HTML!
content.code_example:
Hello, World!

This is my first web page made with HTML!
content.additional_text: In the code above, we start with a declaration that tells the browser we are using HTML. Then, we define the head section, which contains the title of the page. The body section contains the content displayed on the page.

content.subheading: Organizing Content with Headings and Divs
content.text: HTML allows you to organize your content using various tags. Headings are very important as they help to structure your content. You can use <h1> to <h6> for headings, where <h1> is the largest and <h6> is the smallest. To group related content, you can use the <div> tag. It acts like a box that holds other elements together, making your code neat and easy to manage.
content.code_example:
My Favorite Movies

Action Movies

My favorite action movie is 'Mad Max: Fury Road'.
content.additional_text: Using <div> tags is helpful when you want to apply styles to a group of elements or manage related content together.
content.additional_code_example:
Comedy Movies

'Superbad' is one of the funniest movies I've ever seen!

mcq_questions.question: What is the purpose of the <div> tag in HTML?
options: B) To make a division or section in a document

content.text: Lists are a great way to present information clearly. In HTML, you can create two types of lists: ordered lists (<ol>) and unordered lists (<ul>). Ordered lists use numbers for each item, while unordered lists use bullet points. Each item in the list is defined with the <li> tag.
content.code_example:
My Hobbies

  1. Reading books
  2. Playing video games
  3. Hiking in nature
content.additional_text: Using ordered lists is helpful when you want to present items in a specific sequence, like steps in a recipe or rankings.
